Principal Skinner promises the students that the best-behaved can take a ride in a submarine. Bart believes his past indiscretions will be forgotten. Lisa tries to help Krusty by suggesting him to sell the foreign rights to his shows.
When a sudden tourist spike means that the family cannot afford Christmas, the Simpsons open up their house to boarders.
Fed up with the high price of Hollywood films, Homer begins screening pirated movies in his backyard, but is busted by the FBI after Marge turns him in.
Comic Book Guy seeks romantic advice from Homer when he falls for a Japanese woman who's interested in manga.

Mr. Burns' Christmas present to his employees, a pair of augmented reality glasses, places a strain on Homer and Marge's relationship. Meanwhile, Bart wrestles with giving a Valentine's Day card to Nelson.
Bart becomes friends with a schoolmate who enjoys falconry, but turns out to be mentally disturbed.

episode_name: The Man Who Grew Too Much
episode_description: Lisa becomes friends with Sideshow Bob, who now has a new job working with genetically-altered foods. Meanwhile, Marge becomes frustrated teaching abstinence for the church.

When Abe and two of his friends move in with the Simpsons after the Springfield Retirement Castle closes, Homer begins to embrace their lifestyle. Meanwhile, Nelson initiates Bart into the bully group after coming to his defense.
The friendship between the Simpsons and the Van Houtens is challenged when a painting the Simpsons buy from the Van Houtens' yard sale is discovered to be extremely valuable.

episode_name: You Don't Have to Live Like a Referee
episode_description: Homer becomes a referee for the World Cup and finds himself tested by bribers when the Simpsons travel to Brazil.
Marge becomes worried when Lisa starts dating a competitive eater-in-training, while Bart receives gifts from Snake Jailbird for helping him out.
Thirty years into the future, Bart is having trouble dealing with his divorce, Lisa is struggling with her marriage to Milhouse, and Marge is finally fed up after burying yet another Homer clone.

episode_name: What to Expect When Bart's Expecting
episode_description: Bart becomes a savior to Springfield couples trying to conceive when he inadvertently uses voodoo to get his art teacher pregnant.
The Lego version of Homer begins to suspect that his entire Lego world is not real when a toy triggers a flashback to an alternate reality.
When Homer ruins his and Marge's chances of making a new couple friend, Marge decides to concentrate on finding a friend for Lisa. However, Lisa suddenly makes a new friend on her own.
Bart wins the annual "last day of school" race - with a little help from Nelson - and Homer attempts to bring back 4th of July fireworks, which have been canceled due to low budget cuts.
Krusty has a crisis of conscience and retires from show business after his father dies before ever approving of his career. Meanwhile, Lisa becomes worried about Homer's health and life expectancy.
Homer and Bart turn to the open seas to improve their relationship, and Marge becomes a trash talking victim after she drafts Homer's fantasy football team.

Marge opens a sandwich franchise store after her sandwiches become a huge hit at Springfield Elementary. But running day-to-day at the store proves challenging, especially when the same franchise opens another location across the street.
The 25th annual 'Simpsons' Halloween special includes an alternate dimension, a "Clockwork Orange"-style gang led by Moe and a visit from the Tracey Ullman-era Simpsons.
An Assemblywoman brought in by Lisa to stop Mr. Burns' fracking operation ends up falling for him as much as he does for her.
The Simpsons meet the Planet Express crew, who have come to Springfield in the present to stop them from destroying the future.
Bart tricks his family into a camping trip at a strange event known as "Blazing Guy" so that he can get revenge on his sadistic new fourth grade teacher.
Homer forms a cover band with other dads in town when he takes up bass guitar to deal with a mid-life crisis, but the band's modest success is soon overwhelmed by Apu's breakout potential.

episode_name: I Won't Be Home for Christmas
episode_description: Marge kicks Homer out of the house for Christmas after he consoles Moe on Christmas Eve instead of going home.

episode_name: The Man Who Came to Be Dinner
episode_description: An amusement park ride takes the Simpsons to the home planet of Kang and Kodos.
Homer is hypnotized into believing he's ten years old and ends up stuck in his new age when the hypnotist dies, so he bonds with Bart and refuses to take back the responsibilities of adulthood.

episode_name: The Musk Who Fell to Earth
episode_description: Inventor Elon Musk comes to Springfield, and Homer inspires him with a new idea that could revolutionize Springfield, but winds up costing Mr. Burns a ton of money.
Marge tries to get Homer to lose weight. But instead, he finds a support group that encourages him to embrace his largeness.
Marge gets a job as a driver for a transportation app service, while Moe is forced to work as a janitor at the nuclear plant after Homer causes the bar to go bankrupt.
Moe falls in love with a Nigerian princess whose father is working out a uranium deal with Mr. Burns.
The congregation, led by Marge, is forced to resort to gambling in order to collect money to fix the church, which Chief Wiggum destroyed with a jet pack he received by mistake.
After "Duffman" retires, Homer wins a reality competition to become his replacement. But his contract states that he cannot drink beer, which gives him a new perspective on alcohol.
Marge decides to follow Bart everywhere until he confesses to being involved in a bulldozer crash. Meanwhile, Homer ignores Santa's Little Helper when Ned gets a new dog.
The story of Bart and Lisa's rivalry is told when Homer finds an old film strip.
Bart takes up smoking e-cigarettes to impress Milhouse's cousin Annika while the rest of the family learns about Grampa's days in the Air Force.
Bart gets bullied at a school dance, so Marge gets an anti-bullying law passed, which results in Homer being put in therapy for bulling Ned.
Groundskeeper Willie becomes the coach of the mathletes, Lisa and other kids from Springfield Elementary compete against Waverly Hills Elementary.
Marge decides it's finally time to separate from Homer, and quickly moves on with her life. Homer is initially devastated, but soon stumbles into a romance with a younger woman.
A celebrity television chef challenges Homer to a barbecue cook-off. But before the competition, Homer's new, prized barbecue grill is stolen.
Patty and Selma try to quit smoking, but Patty moves in with the Simpsons when Selma takes it up again. Meanwhile, Maggie goes on an adventure with some local creatures.
The Simpsons are proud to be the most festively decorated house on the block. But when Lisa is traumatized at Krustyland Horror Night, she feels she cannot handle Halloween anymore.
After killing Bart, Sideshow Bob doesn't know what to do with himself; Homer wakes up with short-term memory loss; Because of radiation, Lisa, Bart and Milhouse gain super-powers.

Lisa makes a new friend at school - Harper, who happens to be super-rich, while Homer makes friends with Harper's dad and sets out to continue living the good life when Lisa decides to end the friendship.
Broadway legend Laney Fontaine transforms Lisa into a show-biz kid after Homer loses her chance at band camp.
Lisa tries to restore the reputation of a forgotten Springfield female inventor, while Bart takes full advantage of a diagnosis that he is a sociopath.
A tale of Bart's journey from youth to adulthood, where he is constantly in search of approval from his father and in the shadow of his more-successful younger sister.

When Homer loses his job due to Marge's social media post, he begins working as a dishwasher at a Greek restaurant. Meanwhile, Lisa creates an app that can predict the effect any post on social media will have.
Bart and Principal Skinner battle over the affection of Bart's new teacher, and a new milk-based product that Homer buys from the Kwik-E-Mart causes big changes in Bart and Lisa.
Apu's nephew makes big changes when he takes over the Kwik-E-Mart business, and Bart decides that he's through with being bad after his latest prank spirals out of control.
Professor Frink's new invention turns him into a ladies' man, while a new pill at the Springfield Retirement Castle causes Grandpa to hallucinate back to his happiest moments.

Lisa tries to launch the career of a homeless Appalachian folk singer, but Bart warns her that she will just let her down. Meanwhile, Homer tries to rescue the cat, who is trapped in the walls of the house.
Lisa takes a job as veterinarian's assistant, but soon lets the responsibilities of the job get to her head. Meanwhile, Marge decides to take a job as a crime scene cleaner.
Lisa signs up for an opportunity to be part of a mission to colonize Mars in ten years, and Homer's strategy to use reverse psychology to talk her out of it backfires.
Homer tries to raise Smithers' spirits by finding him a man, and Lisa gets the lead in the school production of "Casablanca" alongside a new male student, sparking Millhouse's jealousy.

episode_name: How Lisa Got Her Marge Back
episode_description: After Lisa overhears Marge say that she doesn't like Lisa's jazz music, Marge takes Lisa on a trip to Capitol City to regain her friendship. Meanwhile, Bart uses Maggie as his new partner in crime for his practical jokes.
Maggie will not go to sleep, so Homer tells her a bedtime story about when the Simpsons and the Flanders went to the Grand Canyon together.
After promising Marge the trip of a lifetime, Homer makes a deal with a travel agent to be a courier of a top-secret briefcase in exchange for a discounted family vacation to Paris.
While trying to overcome a fear of public speaking, Homer creates an improv comedy troupe; Marge rebuilds Bart's treehouse.
Marge lets Bart go to the park alone because he's too irritating, then she ends up getting arrested for leaving him unsupervised.
Mr. Burns puts on a variety show at the Springfield Bowl.
Homer finds a new friend in a woman who acts just like him when Mr. Burns hires the other Simpsons as his live-in virtual reality family.
Homer takes the family on a "hate-cation" to Boston after he catches Bart rooting for a rival football team.
The children of Springfield fight to the death, Hunger Games style; Lisa's imaginary friend kills her real friends; Moe recruits Bart into his group of covert barfly agents.
Bart and Lisa investigate Krusty's new candy; Marge helps Homer dress for a promotion; Kent Brockman struggles with the changing media world.
Homer coaches the kids' lacrosse team with Kirk Van Houten, who disappears before the championship game, after Homer rants about him being a loser.
The Simpsons go to Cuba to get Grampa cheap medical care when the Retirement Castle and V.A. hospital are unable to solve his health problems.
Homer discovers an app that makes his life easier, while Grampa learns that he'll be a father again.
Homer is placed in a cast following a workplace accident, leading Marge to receive romance from an unexpected source; Lisa attempts to keep the peace as bus monitor.
Krusty and his daughter spend Christmas with the Simpsons; Reverend Lovejoy seeks converts to boost attendance at church; A Christmas toy scares Maggie.
A Japanese book on minimalism inspires Marge to adapt to a new way of living, so the Simpsons have to part with items that no longer bring them joy.
Mr Burns tries to relive his glory days, and crosses paths with a mysterious music mogul.

When all the fast food restaurants in Springfield become healthy, Homer turns to the last bastion of greasy food for comfort; Lisa must find a good news story when her school radio station is in jeopardy.

Bart ruins Lisa's perfect day out of jealousy and becomes haunted by the manifestation of his guilty conscious. Homer is revealed to be a master chess player which helps him bond with his competitive dad.
Bart and Lisa return home following a traumatic incident at Kamp Krusty, putting an end to Homer and Marge's sexual encounters.
A mocumentary about how Bart became a star basketball player at Springfield Elementary only to fall prey to fame, his own ego and the schemes of mobster Fat Tony.
As Homer and Marge try a different parenting style on the hellraising Bart, Grampa gives him a special watch that becomes Bart's moral center. But Bart loses it and tries everything to get it back.
Mr. Burns opens his own for-profit university, hiring the completely unqualified Homer as a professor, only to lose him to a mad scientist.
Bart bonds with Skinner's mother over their mutual dislike of Skinner and realizes that he could make a bundle by befriending other lonely and disgruntled grandmothers of Springfield for money.
Mr. Burns makes a bet with his old friend that nothing can break Homer and Marge apart. But that's where Moe comes in.

After a successful animal rights campaign, all dogs in Springfield are allowed to go where they want and do what they want. Pack mentality quickly kicks in and the dogs of Springfield assert their dominance by threatening the people.
In a medieval world, Lisa is forced to use illegal magic when Marge's mother is turned into an Ice Walker.
Lisa's sad experience is adapted into a graphic novel, which becomes a Broadway show.
Homer launches Maggie's baby-celebrity career with her whistling talent; Marge is hired to style Fat Tony's brothel.
Maggie gets possessed by a demon; Lisa discovers a creepy/perfect version of her family in an alternative universe; Homer cannibalizes himself.
Grampa gets a hearing aid and finally hears what everyone has been saying about him.

episode_name: The Old Blue Mayor She Ain't What She Used To Be
episode_description: Marge runs for mayor and uses Homer as the butt of her jokes to gain public support.
Homer gets his old bowling team back together and they wind up competing with arrogant millionaires.
In the future, Lisa writes a college application essay to Harvard and recalls disappointing past birthdays that helped shape her.
When Bart goes missing, the town puts together a search party to find him.
Lisa falls for a crooning jazz pianist named Brendan; Bart discovers he has an affinity for chemistry.
Mr. Burns builds a doomsday ark after he believes the world is ending; Professor Frink is tasked with determining who is worth saving.

episode_name: Homer is Where the Art Isn't
episode_description: Homer is accused of stealing a multimillion-dollar painting and only freelance insurance investigator Manacek can prove his innocence or guilt.

episode_name: 3 Scenes Plus a Tag from a Marriage
episode_description: Homer and Marge tell the story of how they went from loving life without kids to being miserable parents.
Bart goes to prankster rehab after a clown-mask prank terrifies the town and ruins Krusty's career causing him to give up comedy and try serious drama.
Marge forces everyone to give up their electronics and go to the book store in an effort to bring the family together.
Homer and Marge attempt to reunite Moe with his troubled family.
The Simpsons' flight to Gainesville gets re-routed to New Orleans, where Lisa must regain her confidence as a jazz musician.

On his deathbed, Grampa makes a confession to Homer about the notes from Homer's mother that got lost when she left. This angers Homer to the point of refusing to reconcile with Abe after he miraculously recovers.
Homer gets Flanders a job at the power plant; Marge feels there's no spark left in their marriage.
The Simpsons go to Denmark so Grampa can benefit from its free health-care system.
When Bart falls into a coma after he is struck by lightning, he is visited by ghosts seeking closure.
Bart ends up in the hospital after taking a dare and lies about going to heaven to cover it up, but Homer takes a deal with Christian producers to make a movie about it.
Marge and Homer travel to a tropical island and go on Marge's favorite reality competition program to win a million dollars.

episode_name: My Way or the Highway to Heaven
episode_description: While God and St. Peter discuss who will get into heaven, the citizens of Springfield recall divine encounters.
Homer wins an oyster-eating contest against the mythical Cthulhu, Springfield is overrun by plant body-snatchers, Lisa finally snaps and Mr. Burns opens a retirement home with some Jurassic upgrades.

episode_name: Baby You Can't Drive My Car
episode_description: A self-driving car company comes to Springfield, poaching all of the power plant employees with their fun work environment.
Bart, Nelson and Milhouse get a mail-order bride for Moe as a hardcore prank.
In search of a job, Marge gets one selling plastic food storage containers - as a drag queen; Lisa tries to make the world better.
Krusty hides out at a circus after he nearly kills Homer, who becomes a TV recapper and gives him a bad grade.
Bart feels neglected when Homer and Lisa bond over To Kill a Mockingbird and start spending quality time together, so Marge attempts to help Homer balance attention between the kids.
Marge is determined to fix Christmas following a failed Black Friday shopping spree, but Homer and the kids surprise her with a vacation in Florida.

Motivated by a PTSD episode Grampa had while babysitting the kids, the Simpsons take a journey to Grampa's past as a post-WW2 toy model for plastic army men, and Abe finally faces his on confused sexuality.
Lisa tries to live a double life when she makes a new friend and gets a taste of what it would be like to live with a more cultured family.

episode_name: I'm Dancing as Fat as I Can
episode_description: Homer tries to make amends for binging his and Marge's favorite show without her; Bart prepares for "Krusty's Holiday Trample".

episode_name: The Clown Stays in the Picture
episode_description: On Marc Maron's podcast, Krusty reveals the untold story of his past movie project, The Sands of Space. Hearing the podcast, Bart and Lisa learn their parents were production assistants on the movie in the early days of their relationship.
Homer steals Comic Book Guy's car and must either prove his innocence in court or reconcile with him.
When a romantic night ends in injury for Homer and Marge, Lisa turns to an unlikely source to fix their strained relationship.
Homer discovers a passion for coaching Bart in video game competitions; Lisa's plan to bring Homer back to reality creates chaos.

Bart's friends start a boys rights activist group to protest Krusty's all-female reboot of Itchy and Scratchy. When they catch Bart enjoying it, they kick him out, so he joins Bossy Riot, a militant feminist gang of sixth-grade girls.
Homer works extra shifts at the plant so Lisa can play in the Capitol City Youth Philharmonic.

episode_name: I'm Just a Girl Who Can't Say D'oh
episode_description: Marge becomes Director of Springfield's local theater, armed with Lisa's script resembling "Hamilton"; Homer joins a baby class with Maggie, and takes a liking to supervisor Chloe.
Lisa is mistakenly given political asylum in Canada during a family trip to Niagara Falls.
The documentary crime series "Dateline: Springfield" goes in-depth to solve the case of Lisa's missing college fund.

Marge starts a business selling healing crystals and other New Age products to the naive mothers of Springfield when Homer's job cuts children's health-care benefits, leading Marge to use the crystals as a cheaper solution for Bart's ADD.

episode_name: The Winter of Our Monetized Content
episode_description: Bart and Homer become social media celebrities when a video of them fighting goes viral; Lisa fights the school's new industrialized detention system.
Homer inspires a 35-year-old millennial who idolizes him to start his own business, which leads the mob to chase both of them.
When the wrong man is arrested for pickpocketing Springfield during the San Castellaneta street festival, Chief Wiggum sets out to catch the real criminal.

The 30th Treehouse of Horror features a demon Maggie, a mission to rescue Milhouse from another dimension, dead-Homer's spirit trying on some new bodies for size and Selma finally finding love in an unlikely place - the alien in the basement.

After visiting Aquatraz Water Park, Lisa and Bart set out to free from captivity the most vicious animals in Springfield. Homer fulfills a lifelong dream and buys a boat, only to realize how much boat ownership sucks.
Marge becomes a competitive lumberjack and goes on a month-long retreat to Portland with her trainer, whom Homer fears will take his wife away from him.

The Simpsons join other Springfield families on the Van Houtens' annual trip to Costa Rica, where Homer befriends Patty's new girlfriend and Lisa discovers how the Van Houtens are able to afford this trip every year.
The Simpsons face various Thanksgiving nightmares, including the first Thanksgiving, an A.I. mishap and a dangerous space mission complicated by a sentient cranberry sauce.

episode_name: Todd, Todd, Why Hast Thou Forsaken Me?
episode_description: Todd blames God for his mother's death and rejects his faith, so Ned sends him to live with the Simpsons, hoping they can scare him into believing in God again.
Sideshow Bob gets the role of Santa Claus at Santa's Village amusement park. Meanwhile, someone is stealing all the Christmas packages off people's front porches.
Homer and Marge attend Artie Ziff's wedding and become quite uncomfortable when they realize that his bride-to-be is a clone of Marge.

The sea captain finds treasure for which he's been searching for 40 years, but City Hall claims it since it was in city limits. Marge convinces the townspeople to use the windfall to build a STEM school. Homer crusades against automation.
Professor Frink invents a cryptocurrency that makes him the richest man in Springfield, a title Mr. Burns has no intention of giving up.
Bart uses spoilers for a superhero movie he saw to get what he wants, but two movie executives will stop at nothing to keep his knowledge secret.
Marge implements a limit on screen time for the whole family, only to realize she's the one addicted to screens.
Jealous of Bart's bond with Ned, Homer mentors Nelson in retaliation, but an act of heroism helps Homer to regain Bart's respect.
Marge gets a job at an upscale cannabis dispensary leading Homer to open a competing business that replicates the scuzzy days of scoring weed from and old-school pot connection.

episode_name: The Incredible Lightness of Being a Baby
episode_description: Maggie reunites with baby Hudson, but Marge isn't too crazy about his mom. Homer befriends Cletus Spuckler who recently discovered a vast underground reserve of helium gas on his property, attracting unwanted attention from Mr. Burns.
Reverend Lovejoy investigates the mysterious past of a new priest who's come to town and shaken things up at church.
In Michigan, Reverend Lovejoy learns the true reason why Bode came to Springfield and the congregation must decide whether to banish their new priest.
Lisa joins a group of rich girls when she makes a friend who loves horses; Homer takes Marge on a romantic cruise.
The Simpsons explore the tragic past of Santa's Little Helper when he bites Marge.
Mr. Burns goes undercover at the power plant as an employee named Fred and befriends Homer and the gang, but a jealous Smithers plots to bring the old Burns back.
At a museum exhibit of Ancient Rome, Marge and Homer imagine themselves in Rome where Homer is more ambitious.
Lisa stays home from school and fantasizes about the history of Western art.
The 31st annual Simpsons Halloween special includes a frightening look at the 2020 election, parodies of Pixar and Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse and a ninth birthday Lisa just can't get over.
Homer is tempted by a British femme fatale while Marge and the kids are on a seaside vacation.
Grampa is accused of a crime, while Kent Brockman questions his career.
Bart becomes a voice over actor, Comic Book Guy is humiliated at Comic-Con and Lisa is set up for a fall.
Skinner and Chalmers take an 800-mile car ride to an administrator's convention in Cincinnati.
Lisa calls Ms. Hoover a hack and refuses to apologize, then learns her private pain.

episode_name: A Springfield Summer Christmas for Christmas
episode_description: A cable channel films a Christmas movie in Springfield and Skinner falls in love.
The origin story of Comic Book Guy is revealed as he and Kumiko debate having a baby.
Bart learns a surprising secret when he finds Mrs. Krabappel's diary at a yard sale, while Lisa discovers an even bigger surprise.
Bart becomes a successful caddy, but Marge thinks it may ruin his character.
Cletus becomes a singing sensation and ruins everything when he turns on his fans, while Homer becomes a new man.

episode_name: Do Pizza Bots Dream of Electric Guitars
episode_description: Homer tries to reunite a mechanical band from his youth, but J.J. Abrams beats him to it.
A secret from Flanders' past and a never-before-seen room in the Simpson home are revealed.
Sarah Wiggum is more than she seems; Marge participates in a jewel heist.
Mr. Burns joins the plant-based burger business, convincing Lisa that he's changed for the better.

episode_name: Panic on the Streets of Springfield
episode_description: Lisa's imaginary friend is a depressed British singer from the 1980s; Homer becomes a truck guy.
Lisa makes a shocking college decision that hurts Marge, leading to a surprising place.
A British secret agent comes to Springfield to find a Russian spy.
A secret society of bartenders seeks revenge on Homer and his friends when Moe breaks their most sacred rule.
Marge stages a revival of a musical from high school, but her pleasant memories are threatened by the return of her old rival.
When Grandpa falls victim to a phone scam, the Simpsons set out to get his money back.
The 32nd annual Simpsons Halloween special includes a spoof of "Parasite" and a segment where Bambi gets his revenge.
Moe is faced with a difficult choice when Evergreen Terrace develops a traffic problem.
Lisa reacts to a hurtful word spoken by Marge while Bart gets swole.
Homer and Ned get sucked into the violent world of prestige TV when a ruthless debt collector comes to Springfield.
Things go from bad to worse for Homer and Ned.

episode_name: Portrait of a Lackey on Fire
episode_description: Smithers finds true love with a famous fashion designer, but this new relationship may destroy Springfield.
In a flashback to his teen years, Homer goes on a road trip with his father to search for his mother.
Fat Tony becomes Maggie's godfather.
Marge battles Mr. Burns for the soul of a brash young football prodigy.
Homer and Marge must push themselves to their limits when they get lost in an icy wilderness.
Bart, Martin and the bullies run for their lives when a weekend in the wilderness takes a dark turn.

episode_name: You Won't Believe What This Episode Is About - Act Three Will Shock You!
episode_description: Homer becomes a pariah when footage of him allegedly leaving Santa's Little Helper in a hot car goes viral.
Homer leads a rebellion of loser dads against the friendship between Bart and a famous kid influencer.
Cletus feels betrayed when he learns that Brandine can read.
Lisa meets the son of the late Bleeding Gums Murphy and tries to improve his life.
Bart has romantic feelings for his new teacher; Lisa befriends an octopus.
Lisa finds an unlikely mentor in Shauna Chalmers when she joins the high-school marching band; Homer becomes a craft-beer brewer.
Marge bonds with Bart when she discovers a secret from her past, terrifying Homer.
Grampa reconnects with an old associate in the hamburger business.
Bart finally learns to admire Homer, but a visit from a magical singing janitor changes everything they thought they knew.
After humiliating himself at a town meeting, Homer looks for acceptance in an internet group on the hunt for a missing tortoise and finds something much more sinister.
Lisa gets called for jury duty, while Marge becomes obsessed with her exercise bike.
Lisa joins the Boy Explorers, much to Bart's dismay
Marge gets a job as a segment producer on Krusty's new talk show, which she soon realizes is a never-ending nightmare.
Young Homer and his friends are terrorized by a killer clown in a special Treehouse of Horror presentation spoofing Stephen King's "It".
In the 33rd annual Halloween special, Marge's resentment takes a monstrous form, Lisa tries to save the planet through murder, and Homer realizes that he's not the man he thought he was.
Homer and Duffman go on a road trip with Lisa that threatens to expose Homer's bad parenting after he becomes Duffman's girl-dad hero.

episode_name: Step Brother from the Same Planet
episode_description: Homer is filled with rage and resentment when Grampa becomes a stepfather to his girlfriend's son; Lisa and Bart throw the ultimate slumber party.
Lisa and Nelson become an unlikely couple in the future.

Bart and Milhouse exploit a computer glitch to make a profit; when they get caught Bart persuades Skinner to join them to raise funds for his dream school. Meanwhile, Marge discovers that she can talk to Maggie in a computer game.
Moe coaches Bart's hockey team and recruits the world's greatest brawlers to teach Nelson the art of hockey goonery.
The rise and fall of the Simpson Family Vlog is told through a series of recommended YouTube videos.
Ned goes into business with the Springfield mafia.
Carl discovers the origins of a mysterious rodeo buckle tied to his identity when he's smitten with a beautiful black woman.
Homer and Marge imagine a world where Bart isn't a Simpson after his latest prank causes chaos at Springfield Elementary.
Kirk goes on a crusade to censor and control the school curriculum in response to a history lesson that paints one of his ancestors in a bad light and Homer comes along for fun and profit.
Jacques returns to coach Marge for a bowling tournament.
Homer publicly disparages a pop singer and faces the wrath of her vengeful fans.
Marge is seduced by the money and prestige of Big Charity fundraising when she and Lisa launch a charity together.
The Simpsons are forced to spend time with each other in lockdown when a plague of insects shuts down Springfield.
Krusty opens a school for clowning, which becomes the most successful thing he's ever done.

episode_name: Homer's Adventures Through the Windshield Glass
episode_description: Time stands still for Homer when he flies through his windshield after crashing his car and as his life flashes before his eyes, a magical friend helps him uncover the truth about his marriage.
Homer volunteers to be a school crossing guard, but his fellow crossing guards become something to fear when his safety squad receives too much funding.
Marge is overwhelmed by her fear of the kids growing up.
Homer suspects that his new neighbor is showering him with kindness to trick him into buying a sports car, but the truth is more sinister than he thought; Lisa puts a stop to Nelson's bullying spree.

episode_name: Thirst Trap: A Corporate Love Story
episode_description: The episode is a documentary, using footage from Lisa's documentary, about a young woman who started a company building a revolutionary new machine that can make sea water drinkable. She just needs someone rich to fund her dream.

In the thirty-fourth annual Simpsons Halloween special, Bart is turned into an NFT, Lisa turns to Sideshow Bob for help in tracking down a serial killer and an outbreak turns Springfielders into Homers.
Bart and Lisa must dig into Marge's past to show they really know her when a bad birthday present breaks her heart; Homer becomes a neighborhood fear-monger.
Lisa tells the story of Homer being a scapegoat for a power outage that plunged Springfield into darkness before Thanksgiving.
Groundskeeper Willie gets kidnapped and the Simpsons follow him to Scotland, where what awaits them happens to be Homer's worst nightmare.
Lisa must solve the "murder" of a million-dollar action figure belonging to Comic Book Guy on a pop culture cruise.
Homer and Bart become kings of the blue-collar sports circuit, but Marge suspects something dishonest about their father-son bond.
Professor Frink believes he's created a monster when he helps Homer land a high-level position at a state-of-the-art nuclear plant in Shelbyville.
Lisa feels a need for both speed and a way to control her anxiety when she becomes a pro kid go-cart racer.
A parenting disagreement between Marge and Luann Van Houten becomes a life-or-death struggle for survival.
Marge gets a job in a high-pressure ghost kitchen and tries to start a union.
Homer and his friends from Moe's go on a road trip to scatter the ashes of someone from Homer's life who has passed away, but their friendship may die as well.
Marge secretly spends a surprising windfall on herself when she gets mad with Homer.
Homer loses his mind over tipping culture run amok.
Bart makes a new friend.
Bart celebrates a birthday that will change his life forever.
The Simpsons encounter death on vacation at a high-end resort.
Lisa has a blazing misadventure in the dark world of Capital City's downtown art scene.
An unearthed corpse opens up a cold case from Springfield in the 1980s as well as a steamy relationship between young Grampa and Agnes Skinner.
Springfield is threatened by giant political rage monsters, Mr. Burns is jump-scared by the ghosts of his abused workers on Thanksgiving and Homer bonds with a pair of extra-terrestrial jeans.
The women of Springfield are featured in funny short stories.

episode_name: Treehouse of Horror Presents: Simpsons Wicked This Way Comes
episode_description: A tattooed man at a mysterious night circus transports Lisa into three strange stories from the innocent 1950s, the chilling retro-present, and a brutalist future where prestige TV rules the world.
The Simpsons are trapped on a flight with the most unruly passengers in America.
Krusty's truth-telling aunt fixes Homer's relationship with Patty and Selma after a fight in an escape room.
Things go awry when British mentalist Derren Brown comes to Springfield. Homer gets hypnotized and believes he is Santa Claus, setting off a cheery chain-reaction through town.

episode_name: The Man Who Flew Too Much
episode_description: The new and improved Pin Pals travel to Capital City for their first ever state bowling championship.
Marge and Smithers team up to become wine-forging Robin Hoods.
Lisa goes back in time to save the Springfield Mini Moose from extinction and turns Mr. Burns into the money-hungry tycoon he is today.
Bart enters the world of celebrity DJ-ing; Homer pushes Flanders too far.
Everyone in Springfield gets hooked on a miracle weight loss drug - except Homer.
To preserve her reputation as a nice person, Marge goes to extreme lengths to retrieve a box full of nasty letters she has written to everyone in town.
The Simpsons become the protagonists of a National Geographic-style mockumentary, showing daily life and human behavior from a wild and natural perspective.
Grampa and Moe strain their friendship and the integrity of baseball when they recruit a Macedonian slugger to play in Springfield.
Homer reinvigorates a celebrity chef's lost passion for food -- with some help from the mob.
Homer and Grampa team up to create a new sport that rivals pickleball, until Homer kicks Grampa off the team.
Marge fears that Bart and Lisa will start to drift apart when they stop watching Itchy and Scratchy together, but she has no idea how bad things are about to get.

episode_name: Thrifty Ways to Thieve Your Mother
episode_description: Lisa is welcomed into the school's super-elite fashion club when she wears Marge's "vintage" clothes from the '90s.

Homer gets Superintendent Chalmers a job at the power plant, where Chalmers discovers huge mutated snails that produce valuable slime, launching the superintendent's new career as a man-o-sphere guru.

The 36th annual Treehouse of Horror features a mysterious murdering monster from out of the sewers, a demonic guest on Krusty's live Halloween special and Springfield's poseable plastic post-apocalyptic future.
On the recommendation of Alexa, the women of Springfield send the men and boys to camps to learn to be "manly" and become the husbands, sons and fathers they want them to be.
Homer and Marge must find out if Bart is truly a bad seed.
Bart becomes Professor Frink's lab assistant, sending the Simpsons into a world of tech billionaires determined to live forever, which puts the future of the internet at stake.
Bart runs against Mayor Quimby's son for student council president, while Lisa learns troubling secrets about the Quimby clan - and about the Simpsons.
Lisa wants to go to a K-pop concert, but every ticket is purchased by an online reseller.
Patty and Bart have Homer declared legally dead as a prank, but Homer welcoming his fake death leads Patty to have a huge fight with Selma and move to Palm Springfield.
Principal Skinner is forced to be a parent to a runaway student he finds living in the school library and takes into his home.
